alert.note: Alert for Grant; Kay (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 1:48PM CDT until May 26 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Chikaskia River near Blackwell affecting Kay and Grant Counties.
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC053-071-260700- /O.CON.KOUN.FL.Y.0015.000000T0000Z-220526T1200Z/ /BLKO2.N.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 148 PM CDT Wed May 25 2022 ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Chikaskia River near Blackwell. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Shallow... short duration overflows occur on low-lying bottomlands along and low water crossings over the Chikaskia River in extreme northeastern Grant and Kay counties. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 24.3 feet. - Forecast...The Chikaskia River is expected to rise to a crest of 26.2 feet this evening. - Action stage is 26.0 feet. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
